Kurangi Sampah Plastik, Dinkes Malut Bagi Tas Pakai Ulang


KBRN, Ternate : Upaya untuk mengurangi sampah plastik saat ini terus dikampayekan oleh Dinas Kesehatan Provinsi Maluku Utara pada semua tempat perbelanjaan yang ada di kabupaten kota.
Kegiatan kampanye sampah plastik dilakukan Minggu (3/10/2019) sekaligus dalam rangka memeriahkan Hari Kesehatan Nasional, Dinas Kesehatan (Dinkes) Provinsi Maluku Utara dan Satuan Karya (Saka) Pramuka Bhakti Husada bekerja sama dengan Kwartir Cabang Gerakan Pramuka Kota Ternate dan Satuan Karya Bhakti Husada Kota Ternate melaksanakan pembagian tas pakai ulang kepada masyarakat.
Pelaksanaan kegiatan yang mendapat antusias dari masyarakat itu dilakukan di depan Hypermart bersamaan dengan car free day.
Kepala Seksi Promosi Kesehatan dan Pemberdayaan Masyarakat Dinas Kesehatan Provinsi Maluku Utara Rahmawati kepada RRI mengatakan, kampanye penggunaan tas pakai ulang yang dilakukan ini untuk mengajak masyarakat mengurangi penggunaan plastik sekaligus mengurangi limbah plastic.
”Dengan pembagian tas akan dapat dimanfaatkan oleh masyarakat ketika belanja dapat dipakai kembali,” Ungkap Rahmawati.
Kegiatan ini juga kata Rahmawati sebagai bentuk edukasi kepada masyarakat sekaligus dapat mengajak masyarakat agar membiasakan ketika belanja dapat membawa tas dari rumah, tidak menggunakan plastik yang banyak, sehingga dapat mengurangi pemakaian atau sampah plastic.
Pembagian tas plastik pakai ulang tersebut sebanyak 250 buah yang dibagikan kepada masyarakat secara cuma-cuma sekaligus pembagian brosur dilanjutkan dengan jalan santai di lokasi car free day.
Disamping itu selain dilakukan pembagian tas di Kota Ternate juga dilakukan di Sofifi, Tobelo Halmahera Utara pada tanggal 8 November dan di Halmahera Timur pada tanggal 12 November 2019 juga bekerja sama dengan Pramuka Saka Bhakti Husada setempat.

Reduce Plastic Trash, Health Balls for Disposable Bags
03 Nov 2019, 20:29 by Nanang Adrany



Reduce Plastic Trash, Health Balls for Disposable Bags



Reduce Plastic Trash, Health Balls for Disposable Bags



Reduce Plastic Trash, Health Balls for Disposable Bags


KBRN, Ternate: Efforts to reduce plastic waste are currently being campaigned for by the North Maluku Provincial Health Office at all shopping centers in the city districts.
Plastic waste campaign activities were carried out on Sunday (3/10/2019) at the same time in order to enliven the National Health Day, North Maluku Province Health Office and the Work Unit (Saka) Scouting Bhakti Husada in collaboration with the Kwartir Branch Scout Movement of Ternate City and the Work Unit The City of Bhakti Husada of Ternate carried out the distribution of reusable bags to the community.
The activity that got enthusiastic from the community was carried out in front of Hypermart along with car free day.
Head of the Health Promotion and Community Empowerment Section of North Maluku Provincial Health Office Rahmawati told RRI that the campaign to use reusable bags was carried out to encourage the community to reduce the use of plastics while reducing plastic waste.
"With the distribution of bags will be used by the public when shopping can be used again," said Rahmawati.
This activity is also said Rahmawati as a form of education to the community as well as being able to invite the public to get used to shopping when carrying bags from home, not using a lot of plastic, so as to reduce the use or plastic waste.
The distribution of reusable plastic bags as many as 250 pieces were distributed to the community for free as well as distribution of brochures followed by a leisurely walk at the car free day location.
Apart from that, besides distributing bags in Ternate City, it was also conducted in Sofifi, Tobelo North Halmahera on November 8 and in East Halmahera on November 12, 2019 also in collaboration with the local Saka Bhakti Husada Scouts.
